newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resid prices steady to down, bears wait.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resid prices steady to down, bears wait.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices were steady to lower again Tuesday, but trade remained light as softer crude prices stirred hopes among bears that more downside lay ahead, industry sources said.
"People are watching (weaker) crude, but there's some (downward) pressure building on the high sulphur side too, and there's still not much demand," said one cash trader.

Traders said a Florida utility awarded 110,000 barrels of 2.2 percent at $19.59 (delivered) and 180,000 barrels of 1.8 percent at $19.68 (delivered) in its most recent tender for fuel to be received prior to December 20.
At the U.S. Gulf, one percent eased slightly to $18.75-19.00 a barrel, while three percent held steady at about $18.25, traders said.
In New York Harbor, high sulphurs again lost ground, with 2.2 percent off another quarter to $19.75-20.00 and three percent down slightly to about $19.25.

NYH physical one percent again was unchanged at about $21.25, with November paper off almost 50 cents with crude to about $20.50 and December paper down a similar amount to about $20.75, traders said.
November New York City gate gas prices slipped about a nickel Tuesday to the low-$3.30s/mmBtu versus NYH November one percent resid paper at a $3.25/mmBtu equivalent.
